result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Erica M Riedel was found guilty of OWI (3rd w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $1200.00 BAIL APPLIED. Remaining balance to be  paid at a rate of $100.00 per month commencing 4/01/2015; alternate 112 days jail.

DNA and Blood draw costs PAID IN FULL. BAIL APPLIED.
Blood draw costs to be forwarded to Waukesha Sheriff's dept.

COMMENCE FORTHWITH.
With Huber, standard conditions along with child care and Defendant is accepted in Alcohol Treatment Court.
04/14/2016 ATC GRADUATE.  JAIL PORTION IS MODIFIED TO ACTUAL TIME SERVED IN CUSTODY OF 51 DAYS. ANY REMAINING JAIL TIME IS PERMANENTLY VACATED AND JOC IS AMENDED ACCORDINGLY.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.
Attendance at the Victim Impact Panel Meeting has been completed.

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt: Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Erica M Riedel in court with attorney Matthew Huppertz.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty. Ct. 2 dismissed by operation of law. 

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
-  270 days jail with Huber to commence FORTHWITH. Huber with standard release conditions (including child care). Defendant has been accepted in Alcohol Treatment Court. 
-    48 months Drivers License Revocation. 
-    48 months Ignition Interlock every vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to defendant
- Attendance at the Victim Impact Panel meeting has been complied with.
- Alcohol Assessment 
- Blood Test Reimbursement of $35.00 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to Waukesha County Sheriff's Department - append to fine. 
- Fine totaling: $6849.00 to be paid at rate of $100.00 per month commencing  04/01/2015; alternate 112 days jail - apply bail 
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 - append to fine
Defendant was remanded to the custody of the Sheriff to commence the sentence.
Character reference letters, Driver Safety Plan Status Report, Victim Impact Panel Completion Certificate dated 1/26/15 filed by Attorney Huppertz.
From Atty Suha advising the Court that if the matter does not resolve at Jury Status that the State will be asking for an adjournment of the Jury Trial.
Filed by the State.
Jury trial - 12 person on February 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on January 29, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.

Defendant Erica M Riedel in court with attorney Matthew H. Huppertz.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests a jury status/trial date, although this case may be resolved. Court grants request.  Jury status hearing scheduled for January 29, 2015 at 09:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for February 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Erica M Riedel in court with attorney Matthew H. Huppertz.  Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense addresses WCS letter previously filed. State has concerns but takes no position at this time. Court orders Warrant quashed. Court orders Bail reinstated (not quashed).  Court orders bail to stand as fixed.  Case continued as set.
